job_info.role_description: Work on data preprocessing, cleaning, and transforming raw data into a usable format for modeling; collaborate with senior engineers to optimize machine learning models for performance and scalability; participate in training and fine-tuning of models; conduct research on emerging AI/ML techniques; document model development and performance metrics; collaborate with cross-functional teams to provide AI/ML-driven solutions; assist in developing deployment pipelines for ML models; assist in development and implementation of machine learning models for business applications

soft_skills: Ability to work effectively in a team environment

preferred_skills: Understanding of machine learning concepts and algorithms
Exposure to AI/ML through academic projects, internships, or online courses
job_responsibilities: Work on data preprocessing, cleaning, and transforming raw data into a usable format for modeling
Collaborate with senior engineers to optimize machine learning models for performance and scalability
Participate in the training and fine-tuning of models to improve accuracy and efficiency
Conduct research on emerging AI/ML techniques and contribute to proof-of-concept development
Document model development, research, and performance metrics for future reference and learning
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business problems and provide AI/ML-driven solutions
Assist in developing deployment pipelines for ML models, ensuring they are scalable and efficient
Assist in the development and implementation of machine learning models for various business applications

questions.question: 2. While training a TensorFlow model you observe loss=NaN. Which of the following is the most likely single cause?

options.text: ReLU activation in the output layer
Gradient exploding due to unnormalized inputs

questions.question: 3. You want to share your local Git branch `feature/ml-123` with a remote colleague. Which command publishes it for the first time?
4. In PyTorch, how do you turn off gradient computation for every parameter in a model before inference?
5. A pandas DataFrame contains a column `price` with outliers. Which scikit-learn transformer is best suited to cap extreme values to a chosen percentile?
6. Which SQL clause is required to obtain only the latest record per user assuming a column `updated_at`?

options.text: GROUP BY user_id ORDER BY updated_at DESC
SELECT DISTINCT user_id ORDER BY updated_at DESC
ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY user_id ORDER BY updated_at DESC)
RANK() OVER (ORDER BY updated_at DESC GROUP BY user_id)

questions.question: 7. In Keras, you add `EarlyStopping(monitor='val_loss', patience=3, restore_best_weights=True)`. Training stops at epoch 42. Where are the model weights loaded from?

options.text: The epoch with the lowest val_loss among the last three
The last epoch before patience expired

questions.question: 8. Which metric is most appropriate for evaluating an imbalanced binary classification problem where the positive class is rare?
9. You need to save a trained scikit-learn pipeline that includes custom transformers so a colleague can load it later. Which utility should you use?
10. A PyTorch DataLoader sets `batch_size=64` and `drop_last=False`. If the dataset has 130 samples, how many batches are produced in one epoch?
11. Which Git command safely moves uncommitted changes from the working directory to a temporary shelf so you can switch branches?
12. You want to perform a grid search over two hyper-parameters: `C` ∈ {0.1,1,10} and `kernel` ∈ {'linear','rbf'}` for an SVM. How many total combinations will `GridSearchCV` evaluate?
13. In TensorFlow 2.x, which callback allows you to reduce the learning-rate when validation loss has plateaued for several epochs?
14. You accidentally committed a large dataset file `data.csv` to Git and want to remove it from the entire repository history. Which command should you use?

options.text: git filter-repo or git filter-branch with force-push

questions.question: 15. When concatenating two pandas DataFrames along rows with `ignore_index=True`, what happens to the resulting index?

options.text: Resets to a 0-based continuous integer index

questions.question: You have a pandas DataFrame `df` with 100k rows that contains missing values in the column `price`. Which single-line statement both fills the missing values with the median of that column and returns a new DataFrame?
